intro: Lastrea neglecta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Lastrea neglecta thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers warm, humid environments.
